1. Core Classes

gstDeviceIO

gstDisablePhantomDisables the phantom whose id is given.
gstDisablePhantomForcesDisables the amplifiers so the Phantom stops sending forces.
gstEnablePhantomForcesEnables the amplifiers so that forces can be sent to the phantom.
gstEncodersToTransformPerforms Phantom kinematics to convert encoder values to a stylus transform.
gstGetJointAnglesGets the phantom joint angles.
gstGetPhantomErrorReturn a device fault (but not other phantom error states) It makes more sense to check the return state of updatePhantom to find out what the current error state is.
gstGetPhantomInfoGets the gstPhantomInfoStruct, which contains various data on the current Phantom.
gstGetPhantomMaxStiffnessGets the MaxStiffness for the phantom whose ID is given.
gstGetPhantomPositionGets the Phantom position in cartesian space.
gstGetPhantomTemperatureGets the Phantom temperature (according to internal temp model.
gstGetPhantomUpdateRateGets the instantaneous phantom update rate.
gstGetPhantomVelocityGets the phantom velocity in cartesian space.
gstGetRawEncoderValuesGets the raw encoder values (order: the 3 base encoders, then the 3 gimbal encoders).
gstGetStylusJointAnglesGets the phantom stylus joint angles.
gstGetStylusMatrixGets the transform matrix representing the stylus position and orientation.
gstGetStylusSwitchStateGets the state of the stylus switch.
gstInitServoSchedulerIntialization necessary to start a servo loop.
gstInitializePhantomInitializes the Phantom - must call before you do anything else with the phantom, returns a phantom ID if successful, and one of the error codes above if not.
gstIsPhantomResetNeededReturns whether the given phantom id is a phantom type that requires a reset or not.
gstResetPhantomEncodersSets the phantom encoders to zero.
gstSetPhantomForceSends a force to the phantom motors.
gstSetPhantomForceSends a force to the Phantom motors.
gstStartServoSchedulingStart the servo loop whose callback is given here.
gstStopServoSchedulingStop the currently running servo loop.
gstUpdatePhantomUpdates the Phantom's internal picture of itself by reading encoders, calculating position, etc.
